Government: Expanded testing for Covid-19 (travelling in risk areas or pneumonia unknown cause)
Government: Avoid travel to South Korea (recommendation)
First case of community transmission
Government: Avoid travelling to Italy (recommendation).
Government: Public meetings with more than 500 people banned (Ban). Paid first day of sick leave (removal of karensdag)
Government: Avoid all international travel (recommendation).
Government: Travel from non-EU/EES member states banned (Ban)
Government: Avoid unnecessary travel within Sweden
Government: Restaurants and bars are restricted to mainly table service
Government: Avoid private meetings with more than 50 people (recommendation). Government: Public meetings with more than 50 people banned (Ban).

Ministry of Foreign Affairs maintains travel advice of 14 March
Norwegian borders to open for entry by some EEA nationals
Norwegian Government strengthens emergency preparedness capacity
Covid-19 pandemic: Government strengthens humanitarian efforts
Government cooperating with airlines to assist Norwegians in travelling home
The Government is establishing clear quarantine and isolation rules
New regulations on quarantine etc. after travelling outside the Nordic region
Ministry of Foreign Affairs advises against non-essential travel to all countries
The Norwegian Directorate of Health has issued a decision to close schools and other educational institutions
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs advises against trips to the United States and France that are not strictly necessary.

Measures to prevent coronavirus infections in social welfare units providing 24-hour care
Information on coronavirus sent to every household
Restaurants to close everywhere in Finland at midnight on Friday due to the coronavirus epidemic
People have equal access to services in the coronavirus situation - everyone has access to the help and care they need
Prime Minister’s Office appoints Operations Centre to support management of COVID-19 situation
Ministry of Social Affairs and Health clarifies the instructions to municipalities on home care services during the coronavirus outbreak
Government strengthens its management of COVID-19
Ministry of Social Affairs and Health gives instructions to municipalities on home care services during the coronavirus outbreak
Government extends measures related to emergency conditions until 13 May
Restrictions on movement to and from Uusimaa enter into force on 28 March 2020
More stringent controls placed on people arriving from abroad
Obligation to work in the healthcare sector secures the adequacy of workforce
Ministry of Social Affairs and Health: Guidelines for protecting health of employees during coronavirus epidemic
Restaurants closed to customers, ordering takeaway permitted
Ministry for Foreign Affairs adopts emergency management arrangements
Change in effect for the necessary travel for work across internal borders
Advice for the over-70s on protecting themselves from the coronavirus
Government, in cooperation with the President of the Republic, declares a state of emergency in Finland over coronavirus outbreak

The premises of schools, educational institutions, universities, universities of applied sciences, basic art education as well as civic education and other liberal education institutes will be closed until 13 April 2020

All national and municipal museums, theatres, the National Opera, cultural venues, libraries, mobile libraries, services for customer and researchers at the National Archives, hobby and leisure centres, swimming pools and other sports facilities, youth centres, clubs, organisations’ meeting rooms, day care services for the elderly, rehabilitative work facilities and workshops will be closed until 13 April.
Prohibiting public events in Finland
Event
SST: "Novel coronavirus – still only low risk in Denmark"
First case confirmed
Danish Health Authority; All infected people that have no or mild symptoms and are not considered particularly vulnerable are placed in home quarantine with daily contact from health professionals.
Aarhus University Hospital made a "drive-through" test facility
Change of Danish travel advice to prevent further Corona infection in Denmark
Authorities reccomend people that use public transportation should attempt to reduce their travel in peak hours.
Restricions of social gatherings - The limit was lowered to one hundred people.
All flights from high risk regions were cancelled.

Danish Health Authority announced a change of strategy, which means that only people hospitalized with severe signs of respiratory illness or shortness of breath, will be examined for COVID-19 infection
Ministry of Justice now advises against all unnecessary travel - closure of danish border
All people working in non-essential functions in the public sector ordered to stay home for two weeks
All secondary education, universities, libraries, indoor cultural institutions closed.
First death of Covid-10
All primary schools, daycare and similar places closed for two weeks.

Illegal to assemble more than ten people in public, all shopping centres and stores with close contact such as hairdressers and nightclubs must be closed, restaurants can only serve take-away, and other businesses must ensure that there is enough space between customers.
Søren Brostrøm admits wrongdoing: Should have tested more broadly"
